content: the beanie is knitted in the round from the bottom up this is a very simple slouchy beanie which will beautifully show off the color changes in hand painted yarns a beginner level knitter should be fine with this pattern instructions are given for head sizes 18 46 cm 21 53 cm 22 56 cm and 23 58 cm as follows 18 21 22 23 these correspond to child small medium and large adult sizes for any questions contact joansgarden on ravelry or email joansgarden1@gmail com yarn gauge 22 sts and 28 row/4 10 cm in unblocked stockinette needles ❖ one 16 41 cm circular needle us size 6 4 mm but use whatever size you need to get the correct gauge ❖ a set of dpns double point needles the same size ❖ one 16 41 cm circular needle one size smaller for knitting the band also needed ❖ tapestry needle ❖ one row marker 1 abbreviations co cast on bobble bind off pm place marker repeat* to eor repeat the instructions following the * to the end of the row round st s stitch stitches stitches k knit p purl kb knit into the back loop of the stitch k2tog knit the next 2 sts together m1l pick up the bar between the next 2 sts front to back and knit through the back ssk knitwise slip 2 sts individually to the rn slip together kw back to the ln then knit the 2 slipped sts together through the back loop this reverses the order of the sts to make a left sloping decrease of 1 st s2kp as if to knit slip 2 sts decrease k1 pass 2 slipped sts over a 2 st central decrease techniques block hat wet it down roll in a towel to remove excess water and then place over a styrofoam head bowl or balloon to dry it is important to do this before you sew the leaves in place as the beanie will definitely grow larger the first time it gets wet knitting in the round use a circular needle until the number of stitches is too small for the needle then change to dpns or use the magic loop technique when knitting a small number of sts on dpns less than about 12 it is easier to divide the sts onto just 2 needles and knit with a 3rd needle stockinette * knit one row purl one row repeat* until desired length is reached if working in the round knit every round tie off secure the yarn end either by tying a knot with another yarn end or if just a single end tying a couple of half-hitches around a stitch instructions band knitted in the round using mc and the smaller needle co 80 90 96 104 sts join in the round being careful not to twist the sts pm for start of round round 1 * k1 p1 repeat* to eor round 2 * kb1 p1 repeat* to
